results.title: Why the U.S. Risks Repeating 2009’s Economic Stimulus Mistakes

results.abstract: He faced off against Coke, wooed a ‘Pepsi generation’ and bought Frito-Lay, fast food chains and 7Up. Ever loyal, he downed a Pepsi for breakfast.

results.title: Emails Show How Pesticide Industry Influenced U.S. Position in Health Talks
results.abstract: The U.S. insisted that new international guidelines on combating drug resistance omit any mention of fungicides — a demand that the industry made but that ran counter to science.

results.title: Harold Evans Dies at 92; Crusading Newspaperman With a Second Act
results.abstract: In Britain, he helped redefine high-quality newspapers and challenged legal restrictions on the press. In America, he brought new scope and glitz to book publishing as the head of Random House.

multimedia.caption: Harold Evans in 1990. A crusading newspaper editor in Britain, he moved to the United States and continued to make a mark, in book publishing and magazines.

results.title: A Quadriplegic, a Specialty Van and a Lifetime of Adventures
